events.message: Customer reported a vehicle accident involving a collision with another car at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and classified under the auto accident cluster based on the incident description.
An insurance agent was assigned to the customer's case to assist with the vehicle collision claim process.
The claim acknowledgment was sent to the customer confirming receipt of the accident report and next steps.
Request sent to the claimant for additional documents including police report, photos of vehicle damage, and repair estimates.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including the official accident report and mechanic’s damage assessment.
Investigation into the vehicle collision circumstances was initiated by the claims department to verify liability.
Investigation concluded confirming the circumstances of the auto accident and confirming customer’s claim validity.
A settlement proposal outlining compensation for vehicle repair costs was sent to the customer for review.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement amount and expressed appreciation for timely claim handling.
The auto accident claim was formally approved following acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer.
Payment for the approved claim was processed and issued to the customer for vehicle repair expenses.
The insurance claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation of customer satisfaction.
